title: Job Openings at Coollink Limited
content:
At Coollink, our passion drives us to create innovative technology solutions that empower enterprises and SMEs across Nigeria and Africa. For over two decades, we’ve been pioneering satellite broadband and IT services, bringing reliable, affordable connectivity to even the most remote regions. Now, we’re expanding our expertise to deliver more than just connectivity—we provide end-to-end IT solutions that fuel businesses of all sizes.
     

            
    



From startups and SMEs to large enterprises, we offer the tools and support necessary to thrive in an increasingly digital world. Our IT services cover everything from cloud solutions and network security to managed services, ensuring businesses stay connected, secure, and efficient. With our Partners, we’re pushing the boundaries of what's possible, ensuring businesses and communities across Africa have access to world-class connectivity and IT solutions. Whether it's urban hubs or remote locations, geography is no barrier—we connect people to the technology that transforms lives and industries.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)  Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO)

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: CEO
Industry: Engineering Consultancy, Information Technology & Broadcasting

Overview


	The Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO) provides high-level administrative, organizational, and operational support to ensure efficient management of the CEO’s professional and personal affairs across the Group’s business interests in engineering consultancy, IT, and broadcasting. Responsibilities include calendar management, departmental coordination, tracking the execution of CEO directives, and handling both business and personal administrative tasks.
	The role demands exceptional confidentiality, initiative, responsiveness, and attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and synchronize the CEO’s business and personal calendar.
	Handle confidential communication, reports, and documentation.
	Draft and prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and follow-up action summaries.
	Follow up on all instructions issued by the CEO to ensure timely execution and feedback.
	Coordinate communication with internal departments and external stakeholders.
	Arrange and confirm local and international travel logistics.
	Maintain records, expense tracking, and organized filing systems.
	Execute personal and executive errands, event schedules, and logistics with complete discretion.
	Send a daily Teams summary each evening, outlining the CEO’s next-day priorities, agenda, and travel alerts.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related discipline.
	4 - 6 years of experience supporting C-level or senior leadership in a structured environment.
	Strong command of Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Teams, Planner, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent time management, communication, and multitasking skills.
	Calm, presentable, emotionally intelligent, and able to handle high-pressure executive tasks with grace.
	Demonstrated integrity and discretion in managing sensitive information.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and a detailed and professional Cover Letter clearly demonstrating relevant experience supporting executives, the ability to manage complex schedules and confidential tasks, and Personal strengths that align with the demands of the CEO’s office to: 24716d91.coollink.ng@emea.teams.ms using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Personal Assistant to the CEO

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: IT / Internet Service Provider

Overview


	We are seeking a highly organized and presentable Personal Assistant to the CEO who will provide executive-level administrative support and efficiently manage both business and personal engagements on behalf of the CEO.
	The ideal candidate is proactive, calm under pressure, highly discreet, and skilled in managing fast-paced schedules with precision.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and synchronize the CEO’s business and personal calendar.
	Prepare agendas, meeting briefs, and follow-up reports.
	Handle confidential correspondence and documentation with discretion.
	Coordinate internal and external communication.
	Arrange local and international travel logistics.
	Maintain expense records and filing systems.
	Send end-of-day Teams briefings summarizing the CEO’s next-day schedule and priorities.
	Coordinate with drivers and ensure vehicle readiness for all trips.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related fields
	4 - 6 years of proven experience as a PA or Executive Assistant to senior leadership.
	Proficiency in Microsoft 365 (Teams, Outlook, Planner, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent time management, communication, and multitasking skills.
	Strong confidentiality and ethical judgment.


Application Closing Date: 28th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: 24716d91.coollink.ng@emea.teams.ms using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Senior IT Helpdesk Specialist – Coollink Nigeria

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time | Mid-Level
Department: Managed IT Services (MITS)

Role Overview


	We are seeking a Senior IT Helpdesk Specialist to lead and strengthen our IT support operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure timely and effective resolution of technical issues, provide leadership and mentorship within the helpdesk team, and serve as an escalation point for complex user and system-related incidents.
	This role emphasizes excellence in service delivery, process improvement, and alignment with ITIL best practices and ISO/IEC 27001 standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and coordinate day-to-day IT helpdesk operations, ensuring prompt and efficient user support.
	Manage the full ticket lifecycle – logging, prioritization, assignment, and SLA-driven resolution.
	Provide second-level and escalation support for hardware, software, and network issues.
	Administer Active Directory, Microsoft 365, and user account permissions, ensuring secure access management.
	Oversee new user onboarding and system provisioning (hardware setup, software installation, network configuration, printers).
	Mentor and coach helpdesk personnel to enhance technical expertise and service quality.
	Maintain an up-to-date knowledge base, user guides, and troubleshooting documentation.
	Identify recurring problems, perform root cause analysis, and recommend preventive measures.
	Support IT asset management – tracking hardware, software, and license inventories.
	Ensure compliance with IT policies and security standards (ISO/IEC 27001).
	Prepare detailed weekly and monthly performance reports, SLA metrics, and incident summaries.


Qualifications


	B.Sc. or HND in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 5 years’ experience in IT support, with at least 2 years in a supervisory or lead capacity.
	Proven track record of managing helpdesk operations in fast-paced environments.
	Certifications such as ITIL Foundation, CompTIA A+ / Network+ / Server+, CCNA, or Microsoft Certified are advantageous.
	Additional hands-on experience with servers and network infrastructure administration will be considered a strong asset.


Performance Expectations:


	Maintain 100% compliance with SLAs for ticket response and resolution.
	Ensure proactive incident management and accurate root cause documentation.
	Deliver measurable improvements in user satisfaction and system uptime.
	Continuously enhance internal processes, reporting accuracy, and service documentation.


Key Competencies:


	Strong technical proficiency in Windows, macOS, and Microsoft 365 environments.
	Excellent troubleshooting abilities for hardware, software, and network connectivity (LAN, Wi-Fi, VPN).
	Experience in server administration (Windows Server, AD DS, DNS/DHCP, Group Policy, File/Print Services) is a strong plus.
	Working knowledge of networking (switches, VLANs, routers, firewalls, and IP routing) is highly desirable.
	Familiarity with ITIL-based service management tools (e.g., ManageEngine, Fresh service, Zendesk).
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a strong command of English.
	Proven ability to manage workloads, set priorities, and ensure SLA compliance.
	Excellent team leadership, customer service orientation, and documentation skills.
	Experience managing and monitoring Centralized Printers, CCTV systems, Video Conferencing, and IP Phone systems.


Application Closing Date: 21st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: career@coollink.ng using “Senior IT Helpdesk Specialist” as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at ACO Nigeria
content:
ACO Nigeria, a subsidiary of ACO Group, is a premier renewable energy provider focused on delivering innovative and sustainable solutions across West Africa. Established in 2023, the company leverages the extensive expertise and resources of ACO Group, one of Africa’s leading renewable energy companies with over 1.2 GW of solar installations.

ACO Nigeria offers a comprehensive range of services, including solar, wind, and battery energy storage, tailored to meet the diverse needs of residential, commercial, and utility clients. With a commitment to driving Nigeria’s energy transition, ACO Nigeria delivers high-quality, reliable, and cost-effective solutions that enhance energy security and support the region’s sustainable development goals.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Channel Sales Representative - Solar

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a motivated and results-driven Experienced Channel Sales Representative to join our team.
	The primary responsibility of this role is to drive sales of solar panels, batteries, inverters and related products to distributors and retailers across Nigeria.
	The role combines account management, business development, and partnership building, ensuring that distributors and retailers not only purchase regularly but also evolve into committed, long-term partners of the company.
	The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a strong work ethic, and a passion for exceeding sales targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Achieve monthly and quarterly sales targets through distributors and retailers.
	Proactively prospect, onboard, and manage new distributors and retail accounts.
	Monitor sell-in and sell-out performance to maximize product movement.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with distributors, retailers, and key decision-makers.
	Provide product training, sales support, and promotional material to channel partners.
	Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction, resolving issues quickly and effectively.
	Develop distributor and retailer accounts into strategic partners with long-term agreements.
	Identify and recommend opportunities for joint marketing campaigns, promotions, and events.
	Track competitor activities, pricing, and promotions within the channel network.
	Provide regular reports and market feedback to management for strategy refinement.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Sales, Marketing, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in B2B sales, channel sales, or distribution sales of solar and electronics.
	Strong network of distributors and customers.
	Strong Knowledge of distribution and retail market dynamics in Nigeria (preferred).
	Strong negotiation and relationship management skills.
	High initiative, self-driven, and result-oriented.
	Ability to travel frequently to meet partners across territories.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talents@aconigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only applicants based in Lagos would be considered.

 

2.) Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We're looking for a results-driven Business Development Manager to lead sales and market expansion in the solar PV and BESS space. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in the C&I sector, EPC partnerships, and government energy projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive sales and meet revenue targets
	Build strategic relationships with EPCs, developers, and government agencies
	Identify market opportunities and lead expansion efforts
	Recruit and manage a high-performing BD team.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering; MBA is a plus
	10+ years in sales, with 5+ in the solar industry
	Strong industry network and proven sales success
	Excellent leadership, negotiation, and communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 29th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: talents@aconigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only candidates that reside in Lagos would be considered.

 

3.) Director of Investments & Partnerships

Job Location: Flexible (Within Africa | Travel Required) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	ACO is seeking a strategic and dynamic Director of Investments & Partnerships to lead capital mobilization, cultivate high-value investor and donor relationships, and drive market expansion across Africa.
	This role is instrumental in securing blended finance, structuring joint ventures, and positioning ACO as a trusted, bankable partner in the global energy transition space.


Key Responsibilities
Capital Strategy & Fundraising:


	Design and execute capital-raising strategies across debt, equity, trade finance, and results-based financing (RBF) instruments.
	Prepare and lead successful applications for donor grants and climate finance opportunities.
	Oversee investor reporting, due diligence, and compliance processes.


Strategic Partnerships & Deal Structuring:


	Build and manage long-term relationships with DFIs, impact investors, philanthropic funds, and climate finance entities.
	Lead structuring and negotiation of joint ventures or co-investments for new business lines.
	Maintain a dynamic investor CRM and ensure visibility on the investment pipeline.


Growth Strategy & Market Expansion:


	Evaluate new markets and sectors aligned with ACO’s mission and financial sustainability.
	Produce investment theses and sector deep-dives to support executive decision-making.
	Identify and engage potential strategic partners for market entry and co-development.


Internal Enablement & Capacity Building:


	Develop toolkits and templates for project finance models, investment proposals, and grant applications.
	Support regional teams in preparing for capital raising, including training on investment readiness and structuring.
	Collaborate cross-functionally with Legal, Finance, Engineering, and Operations to bring bankable projects to life.


Requirements


	Master’s Degree in Corporate Finance, Banking, Investments or related fields
	Minimum of 8-12 years of experience in project finance, investment analysis or fund management.
	Entrepreneurial mindset, with comfort in fast-paced and emerging market environments.
	Willingness to travel across Africa as required.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: talents@aconigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Java EE Trainer",
  "description": "Campus Technologies is an experienced Company in the ICT industry with a major in IT training/education, IT solutions Development &amp; Services, e-Learning Solution Development, and implementation among other businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Java EE Trainer
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a dynamic Full-Time Java EE Trainer with expertise in JSF (Java Server Faces), Hibernate, and Spring Framework to conduct hands-on training sessions and mentor students.
	The ideal candidate should have strong enterprise Java development experience and a passion for teaching and guiding students through real-world projects.
	This role is perfect for professionals looking for a flexible schedule while sharing their industry expertise with aspiring developers.


Key Responsibilities


	Deliver interactive and hands-on training in JSF, Hibernate, and Spring Framework.
	Guide students through Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Security, Hibernate ORM, and RESTful Web Services.
	Teach enterprise application architecture, design patterns, and database integration techniques.
	Assist students in developing, debugging, and deploying Java EE applications.
	Provide one-on-one mentorship to students, assisting with code debugging, optimization, and real-world implementation challenges.
	Guide students in building industry-standard Java EE applications.
	Offer feedback on student projects and assess their progress.
	Update course materials, lesson plans, and coding exercises as needed.
	Stay up to date with emerging Java EE trends, microservices, and cloud-based architectures.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s or Higher Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	Strong Java EE development experience, with expertise in JSF, Hibernate, and Spring Framework.

Java EE Trainer Job at Campus Technologies Limited




        
    

        
        Campus Technologies is an experienced Company in the ICT industry with a major in IT training/education, IT solutions Development & Services, e-Learning Solution Development, and implementation among other businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Java EE Trainer
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dynamic Full-Time Java EE Trainer with expertise in JSF (Java Server Faces), Hibernate, and Spring Framework to conduct hands-on training sessions and mentor students.
	The ideal candidate should have strong enterprise Java development experience and a passion for teaching and guiding students through real-world projects.
	This role is perfect for professionals looking for a flexible schedule while sharing their industry expertise with aspiring developers.


Key Responsibilities


	Deliver interactive and hands-on training in JSF, Hibernate, and Spring Framework.
	Guide students through Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Security, Hibernate ORM, and RESTful Web Services.
	Teach enterprise application architecture, design patterns, and database integration techniques.
	Assist students in developing, debugging, and deploying Java EE applications.
	Provide one-on-one mentorship to students, assisting with code debugging, optimization, and real-world implementation challenges.
	Guide students in building industry-standard Java EE applications.
	Offer feedback on student projects and assess their progress.
	Update course materials, lesson plans, and coding exercises as needed.
	Stay up to date with emerging Java EE trends, microservices, and cloud-based architectures.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's or Higher Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	Strong Java EE development experience, with expertise in JSF, Hibernate, and Spring Framework.
	Proficiency in Spring Boot, Spring Security, Microservices Architecture, and RESTful APIs.
	Experience with SQL, ORM frameworks, and database integration (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc.).
	Familiarity with DevOps tools, CI/CD pipelines, and Agile development methodologies is a plus.
	Strong communication, mentorship, and presentation skills.
	Prior teaching or training experience is preferred.
	Applicant must be at least 30 years old and must reside in Abuja.


Why Join Us?


	Competitive salary and benefits for full-time trainers
	Clear opportunities for career growth and professional certifications
	A dynamic and innovative work environment that encourages creativity
	Hands-on experience with real-world projects and industry tools
	The opportunity to mentor, train, and shape the next generation of Java EE developers
	A supportive team culture that values excellence and continuous learning


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@campustechng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only candidates who meet the requirements will be contacted for the next stage of the selection process. We look forward to having passionate and skilled professionals join our team!.
	If you are passionate about sharing your Java EE and Mobile App Development knowledge and guiding aspiring developers in the enterprise space, we encourage you to apply. Join us in preparing the next generation of IT professionals.

	Develop and implement strategies to increase sales and customer base.
	Conduct market research to identify trends and customer needs.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships.
	Prepare and deliver business presentations and proposals.
	Monitor performance metrics and prepare regular reports.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc./HND in related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in business development, preferably in the QSR or hospitality sector.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
